intro: Adenanthos cuneatus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved adenanthos, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It is often found in heathlands and open woodlands, where it thrives in full sun. Adenanthos cuneatus is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its attractive foliage and seasonal blooms.
